RSL has two ports, when only a specific one is powered the RSL is on (I think it’s the “a” port), and when only the other port is powered (I think it’s the “b” port) the RSL blinks.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eYou could use the RSL either by periodically turning on and off the “a” port, (this is how the Roborio does it) when enabled and keeping it on when powered, or by powering only the “a” port when the robot is powered and only the “b” port when enabled.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2023-03-31T19:23:40.252Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":110,"readers_count":109,"score":57.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":432538,"topic_slug":"powering-an-rsl-without-roborio","display_username":"Rotem","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":54417,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"code
